channel.title: CVE Feed for open-webui -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for open-webui -- all products

item.title: CVE-2024-7037|2024-10-10T14:57:57.866Z -- open-webui -- open-webui%2Fopen-webui
item.description: In version v0.3.8 of open-webui/open-webui, the endpoint /api/pipelines/upload is vulnerable to arbitrary file write and delete due to unsanitized file.filename concatenation with CACHE_DIR. This vulnerability allows attackers to overwrite and delete system files, potentially leading to remote code execution.

item.title: CVE-2024-7048|2024-10-10T14:48:56.131Z -- open-webui -- open-webui%2Fopen-webui
item.description: In version v0.3.8 of open-webui, an improper privilege management vulnerability exists in the API endpoints GET /api/v1/documents/ and POST /rag/api/v1/doc. This vulnerability allows a lower-privileged user to access and overwrite files managed by a higher-privileged admin. By exploiting this vulnerability, an attacker can view metadata of files uploaded by an admin and overwrite these files, compromising the integrity and availability of the RAG models.

item.title: CVE-2024-7049|2024-10-10T14:45:15.962Z -- open-webui -- open-webui%2Fopen-webui
item.description: In version v0.3.8 of open-webui/open-webui, a vulnerability exists where a token is returned when a user with a pending role logs in. This allows the user to perform actions without admin confirmation, bypassing the intended approval process.

item.title: CVE-2024-7048|2024-10-10T01:22:16.902Z -- open-webui -- open-webui%2Fopen-webui
item.description: In version v0.3.8 of open-webui, an improper privilege management vulnerability exists in the API endpoints GET /api/v1/documents/ and POST /rag/api/v1/doc. This vulnerability allows a lower-privileged user to access and overwrite files managed by a higher-privileged admin. By exploiting this vulnerability, an attacker can view metadata of files uploaded by an admin and overwrite these files, compromising the integrity and availability of the RAG models.

item.title: CVE-2024-7041|2024-10-09T19:57:41.184Z -- open-webui -- open-webui%2Fopen-webui
item.description: An Insecure Direct Object Reference (IDOR) vulnerability exists in open-webui/open-webui version v0.3.8. The vulnerability occurs in the API endpoint `http://0.0.0.0:3000/api/v1/memories/{id}/update`, where the decentralization design is flawed, allowing attackers to edit other users' memories without proper authorization.

item.title: CVE-2024-7037|2024-10-09T19:52:21.784Z -- open-webui -- open-webui%2Fopen-webui
item.description: In version v0.3.8 of open-webui/open-webui, the endpoint /api/pipelines/upload is vulnerable to arbitrary file write and delete due to unsanitized file.filename concatenation with CACHE_DIR. This vulnerability allows attackers to overwrite and delete system files, potentially leading to remote code execution.

item.title: CVE-2024-30256|2024-08-02T01:32:06.437Z -- open-webui -- open-webui
item.description: Open WebUI is a user-friendly WebUI for LLMs. Open-webui is vulnerable to authenticated blind server-side request forgery. This vulnerability is fixed in 0.1.117.

item.title: CVE-2024-30256|2024-06-04T17:38:46.158Z -- open-webui -- open-webui
item.description: Open WebUI is a user-friendly WebUI for LLMs. Open-webui is vulnerable to authenticated blind server-side request forgery. This vulnerability is fixed in 0.1.117.

item.title: CVE-2024-7038|2024-10-09T18:26:38.995Z -- open-webui -- open-webui%2Fopen-webui
item.description: An information disclosure vulnerability exists in open-webui version 0.3.8. The vulnerability is related to the embedding model update feature under admin settings. When a user updates the model path, the system checks if the file exists and provides different error messages based on the existence and configuration of the file. This behavior allows an attacker to enumerate file names and traverse directories by observing the error messages, leading to potential exposure of sensitive information.

item.title: CVE-2024-7038|2024-10-09T20:38:40.594Z -- open-webui -- open-webui%2Fopen-webui
item.description: An information disclosure vulnerability exists in open-webui version 0.3.8. The vulnerability is related to the embedding model update feature under admin settings. When a user updates the model path, the system checks if the file exists and provides different error messages based on the existence and configuration of the file. This behavior allows an attacker to enumerate file names and traverse directories by observing the error messages, leading to potential exposure of sensitive information.

item.title: CVE-2024-7041|2024-10-09T20:49:30.595Z -- open-webui -- open-webui%2Fopen-webui
item.description: An Insecure Direct Object Reference (IDOR) vulnerability exists in open-webui/open-webui version v0.3.8. The vulnerability occurs in the API endpoint `http://0.0.0.0:3000/api/v1/memories/{id}/update`, where the decentralization design is flawed, allowing attackers to edit other users' memories without proper authorization.
